Generation I.Red: Its tongue can be extended like a chameleon's. It leaves a tingling sensation when it licks enemies.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: Its tongue can be extended like a chameleon's. It leaves a tingling sensation when it licks enemies.
Generation I.Yellow: Its tongue spans almost 7 feet and moves more freely than its forelegs. Its licks can cause paralysis.
Generation I.Stadium: Its tongue, twice its body's length, moves around freely to catch prey. Its licks cause a tingling sensation.

Generation II.Gold: Its tongue has well-developed nerves that run to the very tip, so it can be deftly manipulated.
Generation II.Silver: Its long tongue, slathered with a gooey saliva, sticks to anything, so it is very useful.
Generation II.Crystal: It has a tongue that is over 6'6" long. It uses this long tongue to lick its body clean.
Generation II.Stadium 2: Its tongue has well-developed nerves that run to the very tip, so it can be deftly manipulated. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) Its long tongue, slathered with a gooey saliva, sticks to anything, so it is very useful. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Whenever Lickitung comes across something new, it will unfailingly give it a lick. It does so because it memorizes things by texture and by taste. It is somewhat put off by sour things.
Generation III.Sapphire: Whenever Lickitung comes across something new, it will unfailingly give it a lick. It does so because it memorizes things by texture and by taste. It is somewhat put off by sour things.
Generation III.Emerald: Whenever it sees something unfamiliar, it always licks the object because it memorizes things by texture and taste. It is somewhat put off by sour things.
Generation III.FireRed: Its tongue is twice the length of its body. It can be moved like an arm for grabbing food and attacking.
Generation III.LeafGreen: Its tongue can be extended like a chameleon's. It leaves a tingling sensation when it licks enemies.

Generation IV.Diamond: Instead of hands, it uses its tongue, which is twice its height. Its sticky saliva grips anything.
Generation IV.Pearl: Instead of hands, it uses its tongue, which is twice its height. Its sticky saliva grips anything.
Generation IV.Platinum: When it extends its over-six-foot-long tongue, its tail quivers. There is a possibility they are connected.
Generation IV.HeartGold: Its tongue has well-developed nerves that run to the very tip, so it can be deftly manipulated.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Its long tongue, slathered with a gooey saliva, sticks to anything, so it is very useful.

Generation V.Black: When it extends its over-six-foot-long tongue, its tail quivers. There is a possibility they are connected.
Generation V.White: When it extends its over-six-foot-long tongue, its tail quivers. There is a possibility they are connected.
Generation V.Black 2: Being licked by its long, saliva-covered tongue leaves a tingling sensation. Extending its tongue retracts its tail.
Generation V.White 2: Being licked by its long, saliva-covered tongue leaves a tingling sensation. Extending its tongue retracts its tail.

Generation VI.X: Its long tongue, slathered with a gooey saliva, sticks to anything, so it is very useful.
Generation VI.Y: Its tongue is twice the length of its body. It can be moved like an arm for grabbing food and attacking.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Whenever Lickitung comes across something new, it will unfailingly give it a lick. It does so because it memorizes things by texture and by taste. It is somewhat put off by sour things.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Whenever Lickitung comes across something new, it will unfailingly give it a lick. It does so because it memorizes things by texture and by taste. It is somewhat put off by sour things.

Generation VII.Ultra Sun: It checks out whatever's around it by licking everything. If you don't clean off a spot where it's licked you, you'll break out in a rash!
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: It licks filth clean with its tongue. Whatever it licks always stinks afterward, so whether it's really clean is...questionable.
Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: Its tongue spans almost seven feet and moves more freely than its forelegs. Its licks can cause paralysis.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: Its tongue spans almost seven feet and moves more freely than its forelegs. Its licks can cause paralysis.

Generation VIII.Sword: If this Pokémon's sticky saliva gets on you and you don't clean it off, an intense itch will set in. The itch won't go away, either.
Generation VIII.Shield: Bug Pokémon are Lickitung's main food source. This Pokémon paralyzes its prey with a lick from its long tongue, then swallows the prey whole.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: Instead of its hands, it uses its tongue, which can stretch to twice this Pokémon's height. Lickitung's sticky saliva grips anything.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: Instead of its hands, it uses its tongue, which can stretch to twice this Pokémon's height. Lickitung's sticky saliva grips anything.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: Wields its long tongue deftly, as though it were an arm. The Pokémon's viscous saliva, once it has been collected and boiled down, yields a strong and highly useful adhesive.

Generation IV.HeartGold: Route 44 Safari Zone (Forest with 3 Waterside points; Mountain, default Morning Day )
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Route 44 Safari Zone (Forest with 3 Waterside points; Mountain, default Morning Day )

Generation VIII.Expansion Pass: Soothing Wetlands , Brawlers' Cave Max Lair ( Dynamax Adventure )
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: Lake Valor ( Swarm ) Grand Underground - Spacious Cave , Riverbank Cave , Fountainspring Cave , Still-Water Cavern , Swampy Cave , Bogsunk Cavern
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: Lake Valor ( Swarm ) Grand Underground - Spacious Cave , Riverbank Cave , Fountainspring Cave , Still-Water Cavern , Swampy Cave , Bogsunk Cavern
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: Obsidian Fieldlands : Space-time distortions Crimson Mirelands : Shrouded Ruins , near Diamond Settlement , massive mass outbreaks Alabaster Icelands : Avalanche Slopes , Snowfall Hot Spring , massive mass outbreaks
